artist: Claes Janz. Visscher II; after Maarten de Vos
creditline: Gift of James A. Bergquist, Boston, in honor of Rachel McGarry
inscription:
In plate, lower left: Catica.5.1.
In plate, lower right: M. de Vos inventor  /   ICVisscher  Excudit.
text: This Christian allegory is a two part scene with the interior of a Jewish temple at the left and the exterior at the right. Inside a priest stands in the bimah using a pointer to lead the assembled congregation through the texts, presumably the Ten Commandments, inscribed on tablets. In the forground, an elaborately dressed woman sits on a throne. She probably represents Faith. Outside stands Jesus. He holds a large cross and has nail wounds from his crucifixion. He puts his right hand through a small window, drawing the attention of the seated woman, thus suggesting another way besides Jewish tradition.
title: Plate 5, from The Song of Solomon
